resources.string: Grab destination packages for your family and friends!
We provide itinerary creator that allows you to build your own itinerary!
The easiest way to know nearby restaurants, transportation and more!
This is TARA Alarm clock. This is where you store your Schedules.
Tap on the button below to pick a time for the notification to be sent
Remind yourself, you might forget something
The text you enter below will be shown as the notification title. Leave blank for default title.

Prohibited Items : Foods and Drinks, Tripod and Pets.
Entrance Fee: Php 500.00 for Adult. 
Students, Senior Citizens and PWD's get a discount of Php 100, just bring valid ID. 
What to Bring ? : Camera, Jacket, Friend, Socks

Open 24 Hrs.
Entrance Fee: Free.
GO Biking for only Php 70.00 - 100.00 for an hour.
Play at their extensive playground.
Zipline! costs Php 150.00 for one-way ride and Php 200 for two-way ride

Entrace Fee: Php 8.00 for Adult.
Student with ID Php 5.00.
Parking Fee : Car - Php 15.00.
Tricycle and Motorcycle - Php 8.00.
Good place for Picnic.

Entrance Fee: Php 30.00.
Air-conditioned museum.
Free Pamphlets.
Exhibit consist mostly of art films/classic movies/documentaries.
Foods and drinks are not allowed
Great place to pray.\nA quiet and peaceful place to reflect.\nAir-conditioned church
Entrance Fee: Php 30.00 per person.\nChildren below 3ft are free.\nCircle of Fun Rides : Php 30.00 - Php 50.00 per ride.

Admission Fee: Php 50.00.
Points of Interests:
* Wall of Remembrance
* Inang Bayan monument
* Various protest artworks
Parking spaces are available for tour buses and private vehicle.
Open 24 hours.\nHistorical Landmark.\nRecalling one event of the Philippines proud history.
Open to the public.\nEntrance Fee: Php 30.00 per head for groups larger than 20.\nObserve Silence.

Entrance Fee : P50 for non Quezon City Residents.
P40 for QC residents (must present proof of residence)
P20 for QC students
Free for all QC senior citizens and children below 3 ft in heignt.
What to do ?
Hiking
Mountain-biking
Picnic
Photo Shoots
Fishing
Unique Ambiance for a Place of Worship/Meditation.\nPaintings on 15 walls, depicting images of the station of the cross.\nHuge murals by a national artist adorn the walls of the circular edifice.
A Shopping and Dining Haven in the Business District.\nA good place to relax and chill out.\n Open 24 hrs.
Roll--a long roll of food stalls, restaurants, coffee shops, and cafe where you can enjoy any food of your choice at a good (or reasonable) price.\nNice place to go on weekends
Great place to dine and stroll around.\nHas a good balance of buildings and nature.

Facilites:
* Lopez Picnic Grounds
* Shell Flower Terraces
* Drilon Orchidarium
* Mini Forest
Open daily including holidays.

TARA offers package 1, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Art in Island allows visitors to interact and have fun with the art pieces. You can take as much pictures and videos as you want!. Here in Art in Island we want you to BE PART OF ART!
also known as National Shrine of Our Lady of the Holy Rosary of La Naval de Manila, is the largest church in Metro Manila and one of the biggest churches in Asia.
This large circular park is good place to go for a morning walk or jog or simple for stroll. It also has a museum at the center dedicated to the city founder, Manuel L. Quezon.
QCX is an interactive and socio-cultural green building compliant city museum which was inaguarated in Quezon Memorial Circle.
Circle of Fun is a kids theme park, it has lots of rides and other attractions available for kids to enjoy. People typically spend up to 2 hours here.
The stadium was built in honor of former mayor of Quezon City, Norberto S. Amoranto. It has a track and field oval, a volleyball court, a tennis court, and a swimming pool.

Approximate Duration : 
10 Hrs/day (From 10 AM - 8 PM). 
Approximate Cost 
Php 3500 - 5500 ,good for 4 - 6 person 
Reminder : Approximation might vary depends on user's preference

Approximate Duration :

Php 3500 - 5500 ,good for 4 - 6 person.

Approximate Duration :

Approximate Duration : 
12 Hours (From 8 AM - 7 PM). 
Approximate Cost 
Php 3500 - 5500 ,good for 2 - 4 persons

Approximate Duration :

Php 1500 - 3500 ,good for 2-3 person

TARA offers package 2, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Balara Filter park is one of the oldest of Quezon City park. It has swimming pools, a picnic grove, a windmill park, and art deco buildings.
UPTC is a shopping center in Quezon City, Metro Manila and managed by the Ayala Mall Group.
Sta. Maria Dela Strada Parish is a Wedding Church located in Katipunan Ave.
The Ateneo Art Gallery is widely recognized today as the first museum of Philippines modern art, showcases works by postwar Filipino artists.

TARA offers package 3, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
It is a perfectly located along the way giving chances to people to at lease pay visit in the church.
The latest food community to hit Quezon City, it features 12 new food concepts housed and backyard picnic style dining.
The Church of Gesu is the Roman Catholic church of the Ateneo de Manila University campus in Quezon City in the Philippines.
The Philippines premier institution of higher learning. Links to all autonomous units and system-wide updates.
Your 24/7 destination for shopping dining and entertainment.

TARA offers package 4, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
A memorial dedicated to people deemed as heroes during the Martial Law period and People Power Revolution.
Wildlife Rescue Center is like a mini zoo, If you want to gauge whether your little one is ready for his first ever zoo visit.
The church frequent for Sunday mass because it is private subdivision. The service is solemn and the choir singers are great.
It provides a perfect setting for all sorts of econmic educational tours whose most significant task would be present the numerous fascinating and amazing facts to everyone.
When it comes to all things underground, Cubao Expo is the deal. It’s the hub for all things hip and cool, from cheap eats to quirky art, from novelty items to indie music.

TARA offers package 5, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Sining Kamalig is a gallery of contemporary art. Drop by to enjoy the beautiful and interesting changing exhibition of Flipino artists.
The best garden wedding venue in the Philippines today. The most popular wedding events venue here in Metro Manila.
The museum provides an overview of the Philippine army. You will be able to see arms and weapons and get and idea of the history of the AFP.
Mystery Manila is the first live role playing game in the Philippines. It is an activity that allows people to try something new and challenging.
A place that is very peaceful. You can pray and praise God. A place where you can talk to God and solemnly worship.
